chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order (968.075(1)(a) Domestic Abuse)(939.62(1)(b) Repeater)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Eugene House was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming. Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Obtain GED/HSED. Obtain and maintain employment.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT. Restitution is set at zero.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  No contact with victim, Kimberly K.
No firearms; weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

timeConds.notes: As to both counts: STAYED pending review on 10-10-14.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Eugene House

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald Eugene House not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

No new review date required at this time

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.   Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 AS TO COUNT #1 (AS AMENDED) Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.  

 AS TO COUNT #2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Kimberly K.  
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 10-10-2014 AT 1:30 PM.  
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  mld

Defendant Ronald Eugene House in court with attorney Joel Mogren.  Defendant Ronald Eugene House in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the sole charge to COUNT #1 and COUNT #2, Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 813.12(8)(a) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class U Misdemeanor."   

On the motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the Domestic Abuse Repeater.  ** This now makes the charges a misdemeanor.  mld
from the State, received and filed.   mld

Attorney Joel Mogren in court, defendant Ronald Eugene House not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-24-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Clerk was advised by Attorney Joel Mogren, via telephonics, that he would be unavailable for today's proceedings due to illness.  Therefore, Scheduling Conference rescheduled to Branch 4 on 5-27-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Ronald Eugene House in court with attorney Joel Mogren.  Defendant Ronald Eugene House in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KIMBERLY K.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ronald Eugene House in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Ronald Eugene House in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
